AMO-Tools-Suite  v.0.3.3
Set of tools for calculating energy efficiency in industrial equipment

Poles.cpp
1 #include <cmath>
2 #include "calculator/motor/Poles.h"
3 
4 int Poles::calculate() {
5  if(lineFreq == Motor::LineFrequency::FREQ60) {
6  if (motorRpm >= 3240 && motorRpm <= 3600) return 2;
7  else if (motorRpm >= 1620 && motorRpm <= 1800) return 4;
8  else if (motorRpm >= 1080 && motorRpm <= 1200) return 6;
9  else if (motorRpm >= 810 && motorRpm <= 900) return 8;
10  else if (motorRpm >= 648 && motorRpm <= 720) return 10;
11  else if (motorRpm >= 540 && motorRpm <= 600) return 12;
12  } else if (lineFreq == Motor::LineFrequency::FREQ50) {
13  if (motorRpm >= 2700 && motorRpm <= 3000) return 2;
14  else if (motorRpm >= 1350 && motorRpm <= 1500) return 4;
15  else if (motorRpm >= 900 && motorRpm <= 1000) return 6;
16  else if (motorRpm >= 675 && motorRpm <= 750) return 8;
17  else if (motorRpm >= 540 && motorRpm <= 600) return 10;
18  else if (motorRpm >= 450 && motorRpm <= 500) return 12;
19  }
20 
21  // Backup case when the Rpm does not fall within any range. Currently the equation for 60 Hz is used. 50 Hz equation
22  // is not available at the time of implementing this.
23  if (motorRpm > 3600) return 2;
24 
25  auto const poles = static_cast<int>(std::floor(std::floor(7200 / motorRpm) / 2) * 2);
26  return (poles > 12) ? 12 : poles;
27 }
Poles::calculate
int calculate()
